Notes: See `Yale <https://e360.yale.edu/features/scientists-probe-the-surprising-role-of-trees-in-methane-emissions>`_ or `Nature <https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-019-00122-z>`_ for more information on methane emissions from forests.

Information: Annual average :math:`\text{CO}_2` emitted mass of dry matter burned due to forest fires
Notes: Forest fires are represented in the land use transition matrix as part of ``$CAT-FOREST$`` to the class ``other``. Reductions in this transition can represent reductions in forest fires.

Variable: Average Fraction of Forest Burned Annually

Information: Fraction of dry matter in forests that is carbon. Default is based on Table 4.3 from IPCC C4, V4.
Fraction of harvested wood products that is carbon. Default is based on Table 12.4 from IPCC C4, V12.

Variable: Fire Biomass Consumption for Temperate Forests
Information: See Table 2.4  and Equation 2.27 in V4, C2, IPCC GNGHGI (2019R)

Variable: Fire Biomass Consumption for Tropical Forests
Information: See Table 2.4  and Equation 2.27 in V4, C2, IPCC GNGHGI (2019R)

Variable: Forest Above Ground Biomass Growth Rate
Information:
| Per-time period average above-ground biomass dry matter growth rate. Used to estimate carbon stock sequestration in biomass matter.
 | 
 | Note: baseline estimates for neotropical regions are available from `Heinrich et al. (2021) <https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-021-22050-1>`_
 | * 3.05 Â± 0.5 tonne C/ha/year (seconary)
 | * 11-20 times less for primary

| Used to calculate :math:`\text{N}_2\text{O}` emissions from organic soils. 
 | 
 | Forest Fraction Temperate Nutrient Poor, Forest Fraction Temperate Nutrient Rich, and Forest Fraction Tropical must sum to 1

| Used to calculate :math:`\text{N}_2\text{O}` emissions from organic soils.

| Used to calculate :math:`\text{N}_2\text{O}` emissions from organic soils.

 | Forest Fraction Temperate Nutrient Poor, Forest Fraction Temperate Nutrient Rich, and Forest Fraction Tropical must sum to 1

Variable: Fraction of Forest Converted C Available for Use
Information: Fraction of carbon stock in forests that is available for use in energy production (biomass) and harvested wood production (HWP).
Half life of carbon sequestered in paper products (HWP)
Half life of carbon sequestered in wood products (HWP)
Maximum fraction of carbon that can be removed from forestland without converting to other land use. Constrains removals for biomass in energy and harvested wood products.

Variable: Young Secondary Forest Above Ground Biomass Growth Rate
Information:
|Per-time period average above-ground biomass dry matter growth rate in  YOUNG (age < 20 yrs) secondary forestrs (entered as a number > 0, this is a positive number). Used to estimate carbon stock sequestration in biomass matter. 
 | 
 |  NOTE: Young secondary forests (incl. plantations) sequester high amounts of carbon for a short period of time. This is only used if dynamic forest sequestration is turned on; otherwise, this variable is ignored.
Sequestration in forests modeled as negative emissions

Variable: Above Ground C Stock in Forests
Information: Total estimated c stock in forests
